it.translation[0].definitions[0].definit: used to refer to a thing, animal, situation, idea etc that has already been mentioned or is already known about
it.translation[0].definitions[0].example: ‘Where’s your office?’ ‘It’s on the third floor.’
I love the spring – it’s a wonderful time of the year.
There were people crying, buildings on fire. It was terrible!
Don’t blame me. It wasn’t my idea.
This little beast is a lemur and it lives in Madagascar.
it.translation[0].definitions[1].definit: used to refer to the situation that someone is in now, or what is happening now
it.translation[0].definitions[1].example: I can’t stand it any longer. I’m resigning.
How’s it going, Bob? I haven’t seen you for ages.
And the worst of it is the car isn’t even paid for yet.
Stop it, you two. You’re just being silly.
it.translation[0].definitions[2].definit: used as the subject or object of a verb when the real subject or object is later in the sentence
it.translation[0].definitions[2].example: It worries me the way he keeps changing his mind.
What’s it like being a sailor?
Apparently it’s cheaper to fly than to go by train.
It’s a pity you couldn’t come.
It seems that we are not welcome here.
I found it hard to concentrate.
it.translation[0].definitions[3].definit: used as the subject of a sentence when you are talking about the weather, the time, a distance etc
it.translation[0].definitions[3].example: It was 4 o'clock and the mail still hadn’t come.
It’s over 200 miles from London to Manchester.
It gets dark very early in the winter.
It’s three years since I last saw her.
it.translation[0].definitions[4].definit: used with the verb ‘be’ to emphasize that you are talking about one particular thing, person, group etc and not any other
it.translation[0].definitions[4].example: It’s Lawrence you should be talking to.
It was malaria that killed him.
It was in New Zealand that Elizabeth first met Mr Cronje.
it.translation[0].definitions[5].definit: used to refer to a baby when you do not know what sex the baby is
it.translation[0].definitions[5].example: What will you call it if it’s a boy?
it.translation[0].definitions[6].definit: used to say who a person is
it.translation[0].definitions[7].definit: used to say who is speaking, especially on the telephone
it.translation[0].definitions[7].example: It’s all right, it’s only me.
it.translation[0].definitions[8].example: Have you done it with him yet?
it.translation[0].definitions[9].definit: a particular ability or quality that is needed in order to do something
it.translation[0].definitions[9].example: In a job like advertising, you’ve either got it or you haven’t!
it.translation[2].definitions[0].definit: the study or use of electronic processes and equipment for storing information and making it available
it.translation[3].definitions[0].example: IT has had a dramatic affect on the telecoms infrastructure.
